verbs.description: unscreen (third-person singular simple present unscreens, present participle unscreening, simple past and past participle unscreened)

entries.meaning: (transitive, sometimes figurative) To reveal by removing a screen.
examples: The mist dispersed to unscreen a scattering of stars which in turn retreated as the moon rose to lean over the shoulder of the hill like a curious neighbour leaning over a fence.
